title: Staute of limitation on EDD overpayment
question: The EDD is adding interest on an overpayment it start in 2005 at $500 and now it is over 11,000 they told me that they can not stop the interest i went to the appeal hearing but the judge did not want to hear what i had to say. is there any way to get them to lowwer it, Is there any law that can help me and if i file for bankruptcy would i have to still pay it, all 10,500 is in interest. NEED HELP WITH ANYTHING AND EVERY THING
answers:
You are in the EDD netherworld, between tax and debt. EDD are difficult. They are even more difficult now that IRS has announced a campaign against independent contractors.

EDD will take your state tax refund (you had better not have one and plan to never have a significant state tax refund)

The source of this overpayment is important. If the computer spit out a check by mistake, it may be "loan like" (but if yo cashed a check that you were not supposed to case it may become "fraud-like". However, if you obtained it through fraud by reporting that you were working when you were not, then its "very-fraud-like". But who will decide this? Well, in bankruptcy (should you so file for relief) the EDD will likely object to your discharge. You will have a mini-lawsuit regarding whether its fraud. (add $10k to your bankruptcy cost to fight it).

You may get them to compromise it if you can prove that you are so old and disabled that you will never be able to pay them back.

If you stay out of bankruptcy and don't pay it, it will grow.

If you have an estate worth less than approx $20k, you may be judgement proof, but the debt will grow just the same in case you ever decide that you want an estate over this approximate exemption level amount.

You should have paid the $500 as it is a high interest rate loan.

If you continue not to pay and continue to live in California the likelihood of EDD collecting is high, because every day more connections are made with the taxing authorities. Example: Federal Restitution became an assessed tax in 2010. It will not surprise me if California government debts become general tax assessments very soon-- but especially EDD debts. So long as you live in California you have a permanent connection with EDD & FTB. So long as you live in California, this debt will be intimate to you.
